title: Use Bracket Notation to Find the Nth Character in a String
content: You can also use bracket notation to get the character at other positions within a string.
Remember that computers start counting at 0, so the first character is actually the zeroth character.
secondLetterOfFirstName would have a value of the string 'd'.

exercises.instruction: Let's try to set thirdLetterOfLastName to equal to third letter of lastName variable using bracket notation.
placeholder: const thirdLetterOfLastName = lastName; // Change this line

hint: Try looking at the example above if you get stuck.
The thirdLetterOfLastName variable should have the value of V.
